content: निग्रहः {@--1@} Keeping in check, restraint, curbing, subjection; as in इंद्रियनिग्रह <ls>Ms. 6. 92</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 222</ls>; <ls>Bh. 1. 66</ls>, <ls>Bg. 6. 34.</ls> {@--2@} Suppression, obstruction, putting down; <ls>Ms. 6. 71.</ls> {@--3@} Overtaking, capturing, arresting; त्वन्निग्रहे तुवरगात्रि न मे प्रयत्नः <ls>Mk. 1. 22</ls>; <ls>Śi. 2. 88.</ls> {@--4@} Confinement, imprisonment. {@--5@} Defeat, overthrow, vanquishing. {@--6@} Dispelling, destruction, removing; <ls>R. 9. 25</ls>, <ls n="R.">15. 6</ls>; <ls>Ku. 5. 53.</ls> {@--7@} Arresting of disease, cure. {@--8@} Punishment (<ab>opp.</ab> अनुग्रह); निग्रहानुग्रहस्य कर्ता <ls>Pt. 1</ls>; निग्रहोऽप्ययमनुग्रहीकृतः <ls>R. 11. 90</ls>, <ls n="R. 11.">55</ls>; <ls n="R.">12. 52</ls>, <ls n="R. 12.">63.</ls> {@--9@} Rebuke, reprimand, blame. {@--10@} Aver. sion, dislike, disgust. {@--11@} (In Nyāya <ab>phil.</ab>) A flaw in an argument, a fault in a syllogism (by which a disputant is put down in argument); <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Mu. 5. 10.</ls> {@--12@} A handle. {@--13@} A limit, boundary. {@--14@} The Supreme being.
